title: Understanding Sublimation
text: Sublimation is the process where a solid changes directly into a gas without passing through the liquid phase. Consider how the arrangement of particles changes during this process.

title: Particle Arrangement in Solids and Gases
text: In a solid, particles are closely packed in a fixed structure. In a gas, particles are far apart and move freely. Think about how this change in arrangement affects entropy.

title: Entropy and Disorder
text: Entropy is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system. When particles move from a structured arrangement to a more random one, what happens to the entropy?

title: Entropy Change in Sublimation
text: During sublimation, the system goes from a solid state to a gaseous state. Consider whether this increases or decreases the disorder of the system.

title: Final Consideration
text: Think about the overall change in the system's entropy when dry ice sublimates. Does the system become more ordered or more disordered?
